sessions.title: API Versioning in Spring
sessions.description: Spring Framework 7 introduces a powerful API versioning feature to tackle the complexities of evolving HTTP APIs while ensuring backward compatibility. This talk will dive into the new Spring tools and annotations, such as the @ApiVersion annotation and enhanced RequestMapping capabilities. We will discuss three different versioning implementations: URI parameters, headers, and query parameters. Attendees will discover how to implement API versioning in Spring Boot applications. We will also see how the API versioning feature is used in Interface Clients, Spring Cloud Gateway and Spring Cloud Load Balancer.

sessions.title: Beyond REST: Crafting a Modern GraphQL API Live
sessions.description: Skip the slides and dive into code as we build a GraphQL API using Spring Boot. Through live coding, we will implement schema-first design, batch loading optimization, and query filtering. Come see how GraphQL solves common REST challenges like over-fetching and endpoint proliferation. We will explore the latest features from Spring for GraphQL, showcasing recent advancements in the framework. At the end, you will understand not just GraphQL basics, but production-ready patterns for scalability and performance. Perfect for developers looking to modernize their API architecture with practical, battle-tested approaches.
sessions.location: Level 2, Hall C, The Hub, Discovery Theater

sessions.title: Bootiful Spring AI
sessions.description:
Have you heard about AI once in the last three years? Then come to this talk, because you are doing it wrong. Unless you went to one of our other talks, then you are probably fine.

But the rest of you: Join us to start your journey to enterprise AI awesomeness with Spring AI today. We will look at how to use Spring AI to portably leverage various kinds of models, integrate Model Context Protocol (MCP)-based services, build agentic systems, and more.

sessions.title: Customer Panel: Keeping Spring Apps Current in a Changing Landscape
sessions.description:
In today's fast-paced software world, keeping apps current, secure, and valuable is a constant challenge. For Spring Framework users, it means managing updates, patches, and shifting best practices. This panel, featuring customers who use VMware Tanzu®, will share real-world strategies for maintaining healthy, long-lived Spring apps.

Learn how they stay up to date with tools like Spring Application Advisor, automation, and strong internal processes. Panelists will share actionable insights and show how they adapt to change while delivering ongoing business value. Join us to discover practical ways to keep your Spring apps resilient and secure.

sessions.title: Implementing MCP Authorization Using Spring Security OAuth 2.1 Capabilities
sessions.description:
The Model Context Protocol (MCP) specification defines authorization capabilities for HTTP-based transports based on established specifications using the OAuth 2.1 Authorization Framework (IETF Draft) and extension specifications, specifically, OAuth 2.0 Authorization Server Metadata (RFC 8414), OAuth 2.0 Protected Resource Metadata (RFC 9728), and OAuth 2.0 Dynamic Client Registration Protocol (RFC 7591).

This talk will step through the authorization flow detailed in the MCP specification and will demonstrate how to configure and customize Spring Security and Spring Authorization Server OAuth 2.1 capabilities to implement authorization server discovery and dynamic client registration, obtaining an access token, and making a request to an MCP-protected resource.

sessions.title: Introduction to Spring gRPC
sessions.description: Spring gRPC is a framework that makes it easy to create stand-alone, production-grade Spring Boot-based applications that use gRPC in no time at all. Spring gRPC integrates natively with the Spring HTTP stack and Spring Security, is observable with Micrometer, and compiles natively to GraalVM native images. In short, it is a one-stop-shop for all your gRPC services, and in this session we will pull back the covers and look at it all.

sessions.title: Leverage Generative AI to Streamline the Software Development Lifecycle
sessions.description: Developers rely on multiple tools for different aspects of development, which leads to inefficiencies, frustration, and a lack of visibility into the entire development lifecycle. This makes it difficult to identify bottlenecks and areas for improvement. Building a modern engineering platform that offers a comprehensive ecosystem enables digital transformation at a predictable value-based cost alongside an improved experience and security posture for enterprise clients. Spring AI with Agentic Framework helps with discoverability of software assets, enforcement of best practices, better collaboration and governance, and much improved automation and observability.

sessions.title: Null Safety in Spring with JSpecify and NullAway
sessions.description: In 1965, Tony Hoare invented the null reference—a tiny design decision he later called "the billion-dollar mistake." Why? Because allowing nulls without requiring developers to declare or handle them explicitly has led to decades of bugs, crashes, and production fires. Java still bears the weight of that choice, but the tide is turning. With JSpecify and NullAway, Java developers can finally bring null safety into their workflow—catching potential NullPointerExceptions at compile time and making the absence of a value part of the type system. In this talk, you will learn how JSpecify works, how to use it with NullAway, and how it helps turn null from hazard to feature. We will also share what is coming in Spring Framework 7 and Spring Boot 4, where JSpecify will help make Spring apps safer and more reliable—in the framework and your own code.
sessions.location: Level 2, Hall C, The Hub, Discovery Theater

sessions.title: Of Microservices and Monoliths, and Everything in Between
sessions.description: Deciding between microservices, monoliths, or a hybrid architecture? We'll explore the characteristics of each and how different architectural styles support various technical, organizational, and operational goals. Most organizations don't choose just one path—architectures evolve, and combinations often coexist. The Spring portfolio offers powerful support across this spectrum. We'll go through an example of the evolution of an application, showing how the Spring portfolio supports structure within a modular monolith and enables a smooth transition to microservices. Whether you're scaling a small team or managing a complex system, this session will equip you to make thoughtful, needs-driven architectural decisions.

sessions.title: Roundtable with the Spring Cloud Team
sessions.description: Do you work on distributed systems/microservices? Are you trying to figure out whether Spring Cloud will work for your use case? Have you run into an issue when using Spring Cloud? Want to discuss a potential enhancement or new feature to Spring Cloud that would make it better for you and the Spring community? Come to this meet-the-experts session and take advantage of this rare opportunity to discuss anything and everything Spring Cloud in person with the maintainers.

sessions.title: Secure All the Things with Spring Security
sessions.description:
"Security is hard!" is what the person who does not attend this talk might rightly contend. But you are going to attend this talk, because you know that getting security right will be a win when it comes time to justify your attendance at SpringOne, and nobody, and we mean, nobody, will give you more working code to chew on than Spring Security lead Rob Winch and his trusty and faithful sidekick, Josh Long.

In this session, we will look at security defaults, password management, authentication and authorization, one-time tokens, passkeys, OAuth (including the amazing Spring Authorization Server), method security, and general tips on how to simplify standing up and validating such projects with Testcontainers and Testjars.

sessions.title: Spring Data 4: Data Access Revisited
sessions.description: The Spring Data team is preparing a new generation of the Data framework for 2025 and beyond. Spring Data 4 will ship with Jakarta EE 11 and Kotlin 2 baseline upgrades, introducing major new themes of which AOT Repositories, JSpecify annotations, Vector store support, and a major Spring Data JPA revision are only a selection. This talk will give an outlook on what is to come and will focus on key design decisions and roadmap considerations.

sessions.title: Spring Into MCP
sessions.description:
As large language models transform application development, Spring developers need standardized approaches to connect AI models with external systems. The Model Context Protocol (MCP) provides this standardization for integrating AI capabilities into Spring applications.

We will demonstrate how to leverage the official Java software development kit (SDK) for MCP (donated by the Spring team) through live coding examples. Starting with basic configuration using Spring's programming model, we will build custom MCP servers as Spring components and show how to connect Spring applications to various MCP clients.

Attendees will learn what the MCP is and how to begin creating their own MCP clients and servers. You will gain practical insights to immediately improve your Spring-based AI development workflow.

sessions.description: Come and talk about your application's security with the Spring Security team.

sessions.title: Spring Spotlight: Defining the Future of Java Apps
sessions.description:
Explore the future of Spring with a preview of what is coming in the next major releases for the Spring ecosystem with Spring Framework 7 and Spring Boot 4. A live demo will showcase enhancements in HTTP-based service communication with Spring Interface Clients. We will present VMware Tanzu Spring Application Advisor for seamless upgrades and proactive issue mitigation. Furthermore, we will delve into the realm of AI-powered applications with Spring AI, a project that enables Spring developers to effortlessly integrate with AI technologies directly within their Spring applications.

The session will culminate in an end-to-end demo, leveraging Tanzu Spring Application Advisor, Tanzu Spring Enterprise features, Spring AI, and the VMware Tanzu® Platform to transform legacy applications into secure, compliant, and intelligent solutions.

sessions.title: Staying Current: A Customer's Journey in Software Maintenance
sessions.description: Keeping software patched and secure is a non-negotiable in today's fast-paced world, but what does that truly entail for organizations striving to stay on the leading edge? Join us for a candid conversation with Joachim, who has committed to keeping their applications on the latest versions for years. We will explore their journey, the dedicated efforts they have invested, and the unexpected challenges and roadblocks they have encountered along the way. This session will provide a rare glimpse into the realities of maintaining modern software, offering valuable lessons on what works, what doesn't, and what it truly takes to stay current.

sessions.title: Survival Guide to Continuously Align and Upgrade Your Spring Dependencies
sessions.description:
In order to stay compliant and deploy more secure applications, you need to implement a continuous upgrade culture.
 
However, upgrading widely adopted libraries, such as Spring, usually requires an upgrade plan to align the priorities of multiple teams that are interconnected because of common components.

How should we calculate the upgrade plan? What if there was a means to automate it? In this talk we will explain how to implement a continuous upgrade culture, fully automated using Spring Application Advisor.

sessions.title: What Is Spring?
sessions.description:
AI is all over the news. Yet, what powers the systems that provide the models and information, and allows access to the AI solutions? For many organizations, the answer is Spring. As the backbone of countless Java enterprise applications, Spring enables the development of robust, testable, and scalable solutions. So, what exactly is Spring and why is it so widely adopted for both AI-driven and traditional systems?

In this session, we will discuss Spring and explore its core principles: simplicity, dependency injection, IOC, and convention over configuration. From Spring Boot's rapid development to integrating AI with Spring AI, this talk provides a high-level, yet practical, overview of the Spring ecosystem. Whether you are new, coming from another tech stack, or simply curious, you will walk away with a clear understanding of Spring.
sessions.location: Level 2, Hall C, The Hub, Discovery Theater
